prolog.author: IBM
Richard Johnson
prolog.publisher: OASIS (Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards)

conbody.p: DITA 1.1 includes a new element, <data>. This element and the content inside it is ignored in the transformation process of DITA files.
conbody.note: Because OASIS DITA 1.1 was not yet approved at the time DITA Open Toolkit 1.3 was released, the functionality described here should be considered preliminary until DITA 1.1 is approved, the 1.3 Toolkit assessed relative to DITA 1.1, and appropriate changes made to the Toolkit, if necessary.
conbody.p: As a DITA content author you can add the <data> element, and put content inside it. When you transform the DITA files to the output that you want, the transformation ignores the <data> element and any content inside it.
If you specialize the <data> element, and put information inside the specialized element, you can create a transform override to use the information.
